cont.entity_a: The D-Link offers a dramatic increase in wireless speed compared to Linksys.
The 256-bit WEP is appreciated for security. Good security features, including 256-bit WEP and MAC filtering.
cont.entity_b: Wireless security settings can cause connectivity issues.

cont.entity_a: Major connectivity issues occur when attempting to turn off SSID. Wireless range can be poor, affecting connectivity. Some issues with connection drops and needing reboots persist.
cont.entity_b: The device often disconnects from the wireless access point. Wireless interference can affect performance.

cont.entity_a: Daily reboots are needed to reset the wireless connection.
The firewall configuration is advanced, with time-based port opening.
Setup is generally straightforward, but some users experienced cryptic setup pages. The router is easy to set up, with a helpful built-in help system.
cont.entity_b: Installation wizard on CD is ineffective. Installation is difficult for non-tech savvy users. Setup can be complex due to network configurations. The device is difficult to configure and often unreliable.

cont.entity_a: Firmware and drivers are not optimized, affecting speed. Firmware updates are necessary for improved performance.
cont.entity_b: Linksys lacks commitment to updating firmware for modern operating systems. Firmware and software are outdated, supporting only up to Windows XP.

cont.entity_a: The router has a cardbus interface, offering faster speeds than PCMCIA.
The antenna may be internally disconnected or broken.
The router generally operates without problems and offers good value. Users appreciate the router's low price and extensive features.
Some users experienced DHCP server failure after months of use.
Installation is easy, but there are issues with VPN connections.
cont.entity_b: Product may require frequent reinstallation of the utility for proper function.

cont.entity_a: Customer service is poor, with long wait times and unhelpful solutions.
cont.entity_b: Linksys tech support is generally unhelpful.

cont.entity_a: The router can handle multiple connections and shares internet effectively.
Some users reported issues with compatibility with certain devices or setups.
cont.entity_b: Product is not compatible with Windows Vista. Incompatibility with modern systems leads to frequent returns. Product works well with Windows XP but not with newer systems.

cont.entity_a: Wireless performance may degrade over time or with obstacles.
cont.entity_b: The product performs well when working, but reliability is an issue. Hardware performs well, but software is poorly designed.
Vista support is poor, requiring manual adjustments.
Music streaming quality can vary with setup. The music bridge can work with coax digital cable for better sound.
